article_text: For the Cal Poly Mustangs, there is only one guarantee — win and get in. With three victories in its last three conference games, the men’s basketball team nets a ticket to the California Collegiate Athletic Association Championships. Every other scenario is a jumbled mess for the Mustangs and Head Coach Steve Reason. Season’s boys (17-7 overall, .5-6 in league) are in fifth place in the CCAA trailing Cal Poly Pomona and Cal State Dominguez Hills by just one game. Poly hosts the Cal Poly Pomona Broncos Friday at 8 p.m. in what turns out to be a huge game.
